alert.note: Alert for Kay (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 11 at 11:02PM CDT by NWS Norman-Oklahoma City
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Kay County through 1130 PM CDT... At 1101 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 4 miles northeast of Braman, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Braman, Chilocco, and Blackwell Lake. This includes Interstate 35 between mile markers 228 and 236. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. This storm may intensify, so be certain to monitor NOAA Weather Radio, local radio stations or available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service.
